name: Movies with "Cold" in the Title! Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following movies had "Ice Cold Desire" as a working title?
questions.explanation:
Basic Instinct.

	Detective Nick Curran had his problems with his job.  They got even worse when he became involved with Catherine Trammell, a writer who was the lead suspect in a major murder investigation.  Nick became enamored by Catherine's charm and lost the focus of what he needed to do to finish the case.  "Basic Instinct" was released in 1992 and starred Sharon Stone, Michael Douglas, and Jeanne Tripplehorn. This controversial film was written by Joe Eszterhas, who also wrote "Showgirls".

questions.text: Inman traveled across the country to find his way back home to North Carolina and the love of his life, Miss Ada Monroe. Can you name this "cold" movie?
questions.explanation:
Cold Mountain.

	This civil war period piece starred Jude Law, Nicole Kidman, and Renee Zellweger and was released in the United States in 2003.  It was nominated for seven Academy Awards. It only received one Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for Renee Zellweger, as the feisty Ruby Thewes.

questions.text: Floyd and Dolores, a father and daughter, got stranded at a deserted gas station during a terrible blizzard.  They rescued Steven, who had also gotten stranded.  Floyd decided that he would give Steven to Dolores as a birthday present.  This bizzare tale intricately portrayed a man caught in the middle of an odd relationship between father and daughter.
questions.explanation:
Cold Comfort.

	"Cold Comfort" was released in 1989.  It starred Margaret Langrick who can be seen as Sarah Henderson in "Harry and the Hendersons".

questions.text: A British spy was sent to Germany as pawn in a devilish game.  He soon realized that he had become expendable.  He had to fight his way back, to prove to them that he isn't.  Can you name this "cold" movie?
questions.correct: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold
questions.explanation:
The Spy Who Came in from the Cold.

	Richard Burton starred in this classic spy drama that was released in the United States in 1965.  In this film you will see performances by a young Sam Wannamaker and Claire Bloom.

questions.text: Two criminals broke into a rural Kansas farmer's home to rob him.  They soon discovered that there wasn't anything for them to rob, so they end up murdering the entire family to cover the botched robbery.
questions.explanation:
In Cold Blood.

	"In Cold Blood" was a movie that was based on the best selling novel by Truman Capote.  Robert Blake and Scott Wilson starred as Perry Smith and Richard Hickock in this dark tale of violence.  This film was nominated for 4 Academy Awards in 1968, however, it failed to win in any category.

questions.text: John Huff was kicked off of the police force for his unconventional policing methods.  He was then recruited by the FBI to go undercover as a biker to catch a gang of drug runners.
questions.explanation:
Stone Cold.

	This was Brian Bosworth's debut film in 1991.  The budget for the film was set at $25,000,000 dollars but only grossed just over $9,000,000 at the U.S. box office.  Bosworth got his start as a star football player for the Seattle Seahawks in 1987.  He other film credits include "Three Kings" and Adam Sandler's version of "The Longest Yard".

questions.text: Eric and Alicia have gone away to the mountains for a second honeymoon.  While away they encountered Kale, a lost drifter who needed shelter for the night.  Reluctantly the couple allowed Kale to stay in their cabin.  After a series of events that kept going wrong, Alicia tried to find out more about this suspicious man.  It became clear to her that he wanted Eric out of the way and Alicia all for himself.  Can you name this deadly "cold" tale?
questions.explanation:
Dead Cold.

	This 1995 action thriller starred Lysette Anthony, Peter Dobson, and Chris Mulkey.

questions.text: A group of rowdy snowboarders live it up at a wild ski resort in Alaska.  Can you name this "cold" movie that starred Jason London?
questions.explanation:
Out Cold.

	This 2001 comedy was the last movie that starred comedian Lewis Arquette.  He died of congestive heart failure on February 10, 2001 and the film was not released in the U.S. until November 2001.  This movie also starred Willie Garson, Lee Majors, and David Koechner.

questions.text: The Tilson family decided they needed a change of scenery so they moved into the country.  They thought that they had found their perfect dream house, until the previous owner started snooping around.  Someone should have told the Tilson family of the dark secrets that surrounded their new homestead.  What is this "cold" movie?
questions.explanation:
Cold Creek Manor.

	This 2003 thriller starred Dennis Quaid, Sharon Stone, and Stephen Dorff, as the wicked Dale Massie.  Interesting note about the production of the film is that Christopher Plummer, as the elder Massie, only spent two days filming his scenes.

questions.text: Johnny Modine was a hardened Los Angeles cop, who was after the man responsible for killing his beloved father on Christmas Eve.  Can you name this "cold" movie?
questions.explanation:
Cold Steel.

	This 1987 action thriller was directed by Mario Puzo's daughter Dorothy Ann Puzo.  It starred Brad Davis, Sharon Stone, and Adam Ant.
